posts.name: tdogb
posts.cooked:
Graduated awhile back and my love for engineering has only expanded, however, I haven’t been able to find a community similar to Chief Delphi. I learned so much through design reviews on cd and frc discord and would love to have a space to talk with other people who love engineering as much as I do!

Looking for an outlet to discuss technical mechanical design problems outside of frc. Does such a community exist?

posts.name: tdogb

posts.name: Andrew Lawrence
posts.cooked: You’ll always get design feedback on Chief Delphi. The best part is, every once in a while, it’s good feedback!

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked: Warthunder forums are pretty good at that. Lots of good designs on there
This design looks great! The mechanisms really look like they’re going to mechanical.

posts.name: Brendan Manning
posts.cooked: I agree with you that is looks great. By which I mean that the looks of it are great. No clue on function.

posts.name: jedgar6
posts.cooked: To me it looks like an in wheel differential/drive…at least that’s my best guess.

posts.name: jedgar6
posts.cooked:
Likely a joke about this. It’s happened a few times now.

War Thunder has leaked restricted military documents AGAIN for the third time in a month. This time it's the AH-64D Apache Longbow attack helicoptor. User BarteG98PL posted the "fully unclassified"

posts.name: tdogb
posts.cooked: Building a hybrid gas-electric Onewheel. Doing a parallel hybrid, hence the differential

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: FYI, you need to think through the “off” state for each drive.  You likely need a brake mechanism on both, if they are capable of free spinning.  If one spins, you won’t get the wheel driven forward.

posts.name: FrankJ
posts.cooked: There are trade organizations for most engineering fields. The trouble with design reviews on a list like CD is that is a little like free labor. Also if you give incorrect information that end up costing a lot of money, you could end up legally liable or being sued. Just being sued is very expensive just to get to a summary judgement.

posts.name: tdogb
posts.cooked: Both spin at the same time. The motor essentially smooths out the torque of the engine and biases the torque to the set point (since it’s hard to precisely control engine torque)
